text.0: goddess of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight.
text.1: how is it that thou seekest not the village art thou not afraid.
text.2: what time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicalas voice.
text.3: seeming to sound with tinkling bells the lady of the wood exults.
text.4: and yonder cattle seem to graze what seems a dwellingplace appears.
text.5: or else at eve the lady of the forest seems to free the wains.
text.6: here one is calling to his cow another there hath felled a tree.
text.7: at eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.
text.8: the goddess never slays unless some murderous enemy approach.
text.9: man eats of savoury fruit and then takes even as he wills his rest.
text.10: now have i praised the forest queen sweetscented redolent of balm.
text.11: the mother of all sylvan things who tills not but hath stores of food.
